Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timotheus our brother,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ which are at Colosse: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which ye have to all the saints,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Which is come unto you, as it is in all the world; and bringeth forth fruit, as it doth also in you, since the day ye heard of it, and knew the grace of God in truth:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: As ye also learned of Epaphras our dear fellowservant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Who also declared unto us your love in the Spirit.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that ye might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: That ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Strengthened with all might, according to his glorious power, unto all patience and longsuffering with joyfulness;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Giving thanks unto the Father, which hath made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Who hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translated us into the kingdom of his dear Son:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, even the forgiveness of sins:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For by him were all things created, that are in heaven, and that are in earth, visible and invisible, whether they be thrones, or dominions, or principalities, or powers: all things were created by him, and for him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And he is before all things, and by him all things consist.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For it pleased the Father that in him should all fulness dwell;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And, having made peace through the blood of his cross, by him to reconcile all things unto himself; by him, I say, whether they be things in earth, or things in heaven.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And you, that were sometime alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now hath he reconciled

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: In the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: If ye continue in the faith grounded and settled, and be not moved away from the hope of the gospel, which ye have heard, and which was preached to every creature which is under heaven; whereof I Paul am made a minister;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his bodyâ€™s sake, which is the church:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Whereof I am made a minister, according to the dispensation of God which is given to me for you, to fulfil the word of God;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Even the mystery which hath been hid from ages and from generations, but now is made manifest to his saints:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: To whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Whom we preach, warning every man, and teaching every man in all wisdom; that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Whereunto I also labour, striving according to his working, which worketh in me mightily.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For I would that ye knew what great conflict I have for you, and for them at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: That their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God, and of the Father, and of Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order, and the stedfastness of your faith in Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Rooted and built up in him, and stablished in the faith, as ye have been taught, abounding therein with thanksgiving.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And ye are complete in him, which is the head of all principality and power:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: In whom also ye are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Buried with him in baptism, wherein also ye are risen with him through the faith of the operation of God, who hath raised him from the dead.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, hath he quickened together with him, having forgiven you all trespasses;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Blotting out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us, and took it out of the way, nailing it to his cross;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And having spoiled principalities and powers, he made a shew of them openly, triumphing over them in it.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Let no man therefore judge you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of an holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbath days:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Which are a shadow of things to come; but the body is of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Let no man beguile you of your reward in a voluntary humility and worshipping of angels, intruding into those things which he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And not holding the Head, from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered, and knit together, increaseth with the increase of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Wherefore if ye be dead with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to ordinances,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: (Touch not; taste not; handle not;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in will worship, and humility, and neglecting of the body: not in any honour to the satisfying of the flesh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: When Christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For which thingsâ€™ sake the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: In the which ye also walked some time, when ye lived in them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free: but Christ is all, and in all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And above all these things put on charity, which is the bond of perfectness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Fathers, provoke not your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: But he that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Masters, give unto your servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Continue in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Withal praying also for us, that God would open unto us a door of utterance, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: All my state shall Tychicus declare unto you, who is a beloved brother, and a faithful minister and fellowservant in the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: With Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known unto you all things which are done here.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Aristarchus my fellowprisoner saluteth you, and Marcus, sisterâ€™s son to Barnabas, (touching whom ye received commandments: if he come unto you, receive him;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And Jesus, which is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These only are my fellowworkers unto the kingdom of God, which have been a comfort unto me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, saluteth you, always labouring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: For I bear him record, that he hath a great zeal for you, and them that are in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Colossians
Text: The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Having made known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he hath purposed in himself:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That in the dispensation of the fulness of times he might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom ye also trusted, after that ye heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love unto all the saints,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: The eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that ye may know what is the hope of his calling, and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And what is the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe, according to the working of his mighty power,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which he wrought in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and set him at his own right hand in the heavenly places,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And hath put all things under his feet, and gave him to be the head over all things to the church,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which is his body, the fulness of him that filleth all in all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And you hath he quickened, who were dead in trespasses and sins;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherein in time past ye walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Among whom also we all had our conversation in times past in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind; and were by nature the children of wrath, even as others.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But God, who is rich in mercy, for his great love wherewith he loved us,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together with Christ, (by grace ye are saved;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And hath raised us up together, and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That in the ages to come he might shew the exceeding riches of his grace in his kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Not of works, lest any man should boast.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath before ordained that we should walk in them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore remember, that ye being in time past Gentiles in the flesh, who are called Uncircumcision by that which is called the Circumcision in the flesh made by hands;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That at that time ye were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope, and without God in the world:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But now in Christ Jesus ye who sometimes were far off are made nigh by the blood of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down the middle wall of partition between us;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Having abolished in his flesh the enmity, even the law of commandments contained in ordinances; for to make in himself of twain one new man, so making peace;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And that he might reconcile both unto God in one body by the cross, having slain the enmity thereby:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And came and preached peace to you which were afar off, and to them that were nigh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For through him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief corner stone;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom all the building fitly framed together groweth unto an holy temple in the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom ye also are builded together for an habitation of God through the Spirit.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: If ye have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me to you-ward:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: How that by revelation he made known unto me the mystery; (as I wrote afore in few words,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which in other ages was not made known unto the sons of men, as it is now revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ by the gospel:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God given unto me by the effectual working of his power.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, is this grace given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And to make all men see what is the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the world hath been hid in God, who created all things by Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: To the intent that now unto the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: According to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore I desire that ye faint not at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: May be able to comprehend with all saints what is the breadth, and length, and depth, and height;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye might be filled with all the fulness of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Unto him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: I therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, beseech you that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: With all lowliness and meekness, with longsuffering, forbearing one another in love;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Endeavouring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: There is one body, and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: One Lord, one faith, one baptism,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: One God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in you all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: (Now that he ascended, what is it but that he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: He that descended is the same also that ascended up far above all heavens, that he might fill all things.)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, pastors and teachers;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Till we all come in the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That we henceforth be no more children, tossed to and fro, and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the sleight of men, and cunning craftiness, whereby they lie in wait to deceive;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But speaking the truth in love, may grow up into him in all things, which is the head, even Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: From whom the whole body fitly joined together and compacted by that which every joint supplieth, according to the effectual working in the measure of every part, maketh increase of the body unto the edifying of itself in love.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that ye henceforth walk not as other Gentiles walk, in the vanity of their mind,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Having the understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Who being past feeling have given themselves over unto lasciviousness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But ye have not so learned Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: If so be that ye have heard him, and have been taught by him, as the truth is in Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That ye put off concerning the former conversation the old man, which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And that ye put on the new man, which after God is created in righteousness and true holiness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Neither give place to the devil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And grieve not the holy Spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christâ€™s sake hath forgiven you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Honour thy father and mother; which is the first commandment with promise;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Servants, be obedient to them that are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as unto Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether he be bond or free.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And, ye masters, do the same things unto them, forbearing threatening: knowing that your Master also is in heaven; neither is there respect of persons with him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all saints;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to make known the mystery of the gospel,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For which I am an ambassador in bonds: that therein I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But that ye also may know my affairs, and how I do, Tychicus, a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know our affairs, and that he might comfort your hearts.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus, (this is Ahasuerus which reigned, from India even unto Ethiopia, over an hundred and seven and twenty provinces:)

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: That in those days, when the king Ahasuerus sat on the throne of his kingdom, which was in Shushan the palace,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In the third year of his reign, he made a feast unto all his princes and his servants; the power of Persia and Media, the nobles and princes of the provinces, being before him:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: When he shewed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honour of his excellent majesty many days, even an hundred and fourscore days.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when these days were expired, the king made a feast unto all the people that were present in Shushan the palace, both unto great and small, seven days, in the court of the garden of the kingâ€™s palace;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Where were white, green, and blue, hangings, fastened with cords of fine linen and purple to silver rings and pillars of marble: the beds were of gold and silver, upon a pavement of red, and blue, and white, and black, marble.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they gave them drink in vessels of gold, (the vessels being diverse one from another,) and royal wine in abundance, according to the state of the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the drinking was according to the law; none did compel: for so the king had appointed to all the officers of his house, that they should do according to every manâ€™s pleasure.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Also Vashti the queen made a feast for the women in the royal house which belonged to king Ahasuerus.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was merry with wine, he commanded Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, and Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas, the seven chamberlains that served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: To bring Vashti the queen before the king with the crown royal, to shew the people and the princes her beauty: for she was fair to look on.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But the queen Vashti refused to come at the kingâ€™s commandment by his chamberlains: therefore was the king very wroth, and his anger burned in him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king said to the wise men, which knew the times, (for so was the kingâ€™s manner toward all that knew law and judgment:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the next unto him was Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan, the seven princes of Persia and Media, which saw the kingâ€™s face, and which sat the first in the kingdom;)

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: What shall we do unto the queen Vashti according to law, because she hath not performed the commandment of the king Ahasuerus by the chamberlains?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Memucan answered before the king and the princes, Vashti the queen hath not done wrong to the king only, but also to all the princes, and to all the people that are in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For this deed of the queen shall come abroad unto all women, so that they shall despise their husbands in their eyes, when it shall be reported, The king Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him, but she came not.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Likewise shall the ladies of Persia and Media say this day unto all the kingâ€™s princes, which have heard of the deed of the queen. Thus shall there arise too much contempt and wrath.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: If it please the king, let there go a royal commandment from him, and let it be written among the laws of the Persians and the Medes, that it be not altered, That Vashti come no more before king Ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estate unto another that is better than she.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when the kingâ€™s decree which he shall make shall be published throughout all his empire, (for it is great,) all the wives shall give to their husbands honour, both to great and small.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the saying pleased the king and the princes; and the king did according to the word of Memucan:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For he sent letters into all the kingâ€™s provinces, into every province according to the writing thereof, and to every people after their language, that every man should bear rule in his own house, and that it should be published according to the language of every people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: After these things, when the wrath of king Ahasuerus was appeased, he remembered Vashti, and what she had done, and what was decreed against her.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then said the kingâ€™s servants that ministered unto him, Let there be fair young virgins sought for the king:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And let the king appoint officers in all the provinces of his kingdom, that they may gather together all the fair young virgins unto Shushan the palace, to the house of the women, unto the custody of Hege the kingâ€™s chamberlain, keeper of the women; and let their things for purification be given them:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And let the maiden which pleaseth the king be queen instead of Vashti. And the thing pleased the king; and he did so.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now in Shushan the palace there was a certain Jew, whose name was Mordecai, the son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish, a Benjamite;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Who had been carried away from Jerusalem with the captivity which had been carried away with Jeconiah king of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he brought up Hadassah, that is, Esther, his uncleâ€™s daughter: for she had neither father nor mother, and the maid was fair and beautiful; whom Mordecai, when her father and mother were dead, took for his own daughter.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So it came to pass, when the kingâ€™s commandment and his decree was heard, and when many maidens were gathered together unto Shushan the palace, to the custody of Hegai, that Esther was brought also unto the kingâ€™s house, to the custody of Hegai, keeper of the women.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the maiden pleased him, and she obtained kindness of him; and he speedily gave her her things for purification, with such things as belonged to her, and seven maidens, which were meet to be given her, out of the kingâ€™s house: and he preferred her and her maids unto the best place of the house of the women.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Esther had not shewed her people nor her kindred: for Mordecai had charged her that she should not shew it.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mordecai walked every day before the court of the womenâ€™s house, to know how Esther did, and what should become of her.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now when every maidâ€™s turn was come to go in to king Ahasuerus, after that she had been twelve months, according to the manner of the women, (for so were the days of their purifications accomplished, to wit, six months with oil of myrrh, and six months with sweet odours, and with other things for the purifying of the women;)

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then thus came every maiden unto the king; whatsoever she desired was given her to go with her out of the house of the women unto the kingâ€™s house.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In the evening she went, and on the morrow she returned into the second house of the women, to the custody of Shaashgaz, the kingâ€™s chamberlain, which kept the concubines: she came in unto the king no more, except the king delighted in her, and that she were called by name.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now when the turn of Esther, the daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai, who had taken her for his daughter, was come to go in unto the king, she required nothing but what Hegai the kingâ€™s chamberlain, the keeper of the women, appointed. And Esther obtained favour in the sight of all them that looked upon her.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Esther was taken unto king Ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month, which is the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king loved Esther above all the women, and she obtained grace and favour in his sight more than all the virgins; so that he set the royal crown upon her head, and made her queen instead of Vashti.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king made a great feast unto all his princes and his servants, even Estherâ€™s feast; and he made a release to the provinces, and gave gifts, according to the state of the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when the virgins were gathered together the second time, then Mordecai sat in the kingâ€™s gate.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Esther had not yet shewed her kindred nor her people; as Mordecai had charged her: for Esther did the commandment of Mordecai, like as when she was brought up with him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In those days, while Mordecai sat in the kingâ€™s gate, two of the kingâ€™s chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those which kept the door, were wroth, and sought to lay hands on the king Ahasuerus.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the thing was known to Mordecai, who told it unto Esther the queen; and Esther certified the king thereof in Mordecaiâ€™s name.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when inquisition was made of the matter, it was found out; therefore they were both hanged on a tree: and it was written in the book of the chronicles before the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: After these things did king Ahasuerus promote Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes that were with him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And all the kingâ€™s servants, that were in the kingâ€™s gate, bowed, and reverenced Haman: for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the kingâ€™s servants, which were in the kingâ€™s gate, said unto Mordecai, Why transgressest thou the kingâ€™s commandment?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now it came to pass, when they spake daily unto him, and he hearkened not unto them, that they told Haman, to see whether Mordecaiâ€™s matters would stand: for he had told them that he was a Jew.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when Haman saw that Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence, then was Haman full of wrath.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he thought scorn to lay hands on Mordecai alone; for they had shewed him the people of Mordecai: wherefore Haman sought to destroy all the Jews that were throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus, even the people of Mordecai.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In the first month, that is, the month Nisan, in the twelfth year of king Ahasuerus, they cast Pur, that is, the lot, before Haman from day to day, and from month to month, to the twelfth month, that is, the month Adar.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Haman said unto king Ahasuerus, There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of thy kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the kingâ€™s laws: therefore it is not for the kingâ€™s profit to suffer them.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: If it please the king, let it be written that they may be destroyed: and I will pay ten thousand talents of silver to the hands of those that have the charge of the business, to bring it into the kingâ€™s treasuries.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king took his ring from his hand, and gave it unto Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the Jewsâ€™ enemy.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said unto Haman, The silver is given to thee, the people also, to do with them as it seemeth good to thee.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then were the kingâ€™s scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month, and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded unto the kingâ€™s lieutenants, and to the governors that were over every province, and to the rulers of every people of every province according to the writing thereof, and to every people after their language; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written, and sealed with the kingâ€™s ring.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the letters were sent by posts into all the kingâ€™s provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day, even upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, and to take the spoil of them for a prey.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The copy of the writing for a commandment to be given in every province was published unto all people, that they should be ready against that day.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The posts went out, being hastened by the kingâ€™s commandment, and the decree was given in Shushan the palace. And the king and Haman sat down to drink; but the city Shushan was perplexed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: When Mordecai perceived all that was done, Mordecai rent his clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the midst of the city, and cried with a loud and a bitter cry;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And came even before the kingâ€™s gate: for none might enter into the kingâ€™s gate clothed with sackcloth.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And in every province, whithersoever the kingâ€™s commandment and his decree came, there was great mourning among the Jews, and fasting, and weeping, and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Estherâ€™s maids and her chamberlains came and told it her. Then was the queen exceedingly grieved; and she sent raiment to clothe Mordecai, and to take away his sackcloth from him: but he received it not.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then called Esther for Hatach, one of the kingâ€™s chamberlains, whom he had appointed to attend upon her, and gave him a commandment to Mordecai, to know what it was, and why it was.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Hatach went forth to Mordecai unto the street of the city, which was before the kingâ€™s gate.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mordecai told him of all that had happened unto him, and of the sum of the money that Haman had promised to pay to the kingâ€™s treasuries for the Jews, to destroy them.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Also he gave him the copy of the writing of the decree that was given at Shushan to destroy them, to shew it unto Esther, and to declare it unto her, and to charge her that she should go in unto the king, to make supplication unto him, and to make request before him for her people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Hatach came and told Esther the words of Mordecai.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Again Esther spake unto Hatach, and gave him commandment unto Mordecai;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: All the kingâ€™s servants, and the people of the kingâ€™s provinces, do know, that whosoever, whether man or woman, shall come unto the king into the inner court, who is not called, there is one law of his to put him to death, except such to whom the king shall hold out the golden sceptre, that he may live: but I have not been called to come in unto the king these thirty days.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they told to Mordecai Estherâ€™s words.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then Mordecai commanded to answer Esther, Think not with thyself that thou shalt escape in the kingâ€™s house, more than all the Jews.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For if thou altogether holdest thy peace at this time, then shall there enlargement and deliverance arise to the Jews from another place; but thou and thy fatherâ€™s house shall be destroyed: and who knoweth whether thou art come to the kingdom for such a time as this?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then Esther bade them return Mordecai this answer,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Go, gather together all the Jews that are present in Shushan, and fast ye for me, and neither eat nor drink three days, night or day: I also and my maidens will fast likewise; and so will I go in unto the king, which is not according to the law: and if I perish, I perish.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Mordecai went his way, and did according to all that Esther had commanded him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now it came to pass on the third day, that Esther put on her royal apparel, and stood in the inner court of the kingâ€™s house, over against the kingâ€™s house: and the king sat upon his royal throne in the royal house, over against the gate of the house.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And it was so, when the king saw Esther the queen standing in the court, that she obtained favour in his sight: and the king held out to Esther the golden sceptre that was in his hand. So Esther drew near, and touched the top of the sceptre.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then said the king unto her, What wilt thou, queen Esther? and what is thy request? it shall be even given thee to the half of the kingdom.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Esther answered, If it seem good unto the king, let the king and Haman come this day unto the banquet that I have prepared for him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king said, Cause Haman to make haste, that he may do as Esther hath said. So the king and Haman came to the banquet that Esther had prepared.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said unto Esther at the banquet of wine, What is thy petition? and it shall be granted thee: and what is thy request? even to the half of the kingdom it shall be performed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then answered Esther, and said, My petition and my request is;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: If I have found favour in the sight of the king, and if it please the king to grant my petition, and to perform my request, let the king and Haman come to the banquet that I shall prepare for them, and I will do to morrow as the king hath said.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then went Haman forth that day joyful and with a glad heart: but when Haman saw Mordecai in the kingâ€™s gate, that he stood not up, nor moved for him, he was full of indignation against Mordecai.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Nevertheless Haman refrained himself: and when he came home, he sent and called for his friends, and Zeresh his wife.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Haman told them of the glory of his riches, and the multitude of his children, and all the things wherein the king had promoted him, and how he had advanced him above the princes and servants of the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Haman said moreover, Yea, Esther the queen did let no man come in with the king unto the banquet that she had prepared but myself; and to morrow am I invited unto her also with the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Yet all this availeth me nothing, so long as I see Mordecai the Jew sitting at the kingâ€™s gate.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then said Zeresh his wife and all his friends unto him, Let a gallows be made of fifty cubits high, and to morrow speak thou unto the king that Mordecai may be hanged thereon: then go thou in merrily with the king unto the banquet. And the thing pleased Haman; and he caused the gallows to be made.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: On that night could not the king sleep, and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles; and they were read before the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And it was found written, that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh, two of the kingâ€™s chamberlains, the keepers of the door, who sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said, What honour and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this? Then said the kingâ€™s servants that ministered unto him, There is nothing done for him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said, Who is in the court? Now Haman was come into the outward court of the kingâ€™s house, to speak unto the king to hang Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the kingâ€™s servants said unto him, Behold, Haman standeth in the court. And the king said, Let him come in.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Haman came in. And the king said unto him, What shall be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour? Now Haman thought in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honour more than to myself?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Haman answered the king, For the man whom the king delighteth to honour,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Let the royal apparel be brought which the king useth to wear, and the horse that the king rideth upon, and the crown royal which is set upon his head:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And let this apparel and horse be delivered to the hand of one of the kingâ€™s most noble princes, that they may array the man withal whom the king delighteth to honour, and bring him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaim before him, Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delighteth to honour.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king said to Haman, Make haste, and take the apparel and the horse, as thou hast said, and do even so to Mordecai the Jew, that sitteth at the kingâ€™s gate: let nothing fail of all that thou hast spoken.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then took Haman the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and brought him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaimed before him, Thus shall it be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mordecai came again to the kingâ€™s gate. But Haman hasted to his house mourning, and having his head covered.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Haman told Zeresh his wife and all his friends every thing that had befallen him. Then said his wise men and Zeresh his wife unto him, If Mordecai be of the seed of the Jews, before whom thou hast begun to fall, thou shalt not prevail against him, but shalt surely fall before him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And while they were yet talking with him, came the kingâ€™s chamberlains, and hasted to bring Haman unto the banquet that Esther had prepared.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So the king and Haman came to banquet with Esther the queen.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said again unto Esther on the second day at the banquet of wine, What is thy petition, queen Esther? and it shall be granted thee: and what is thy request? and it shall be performed, even to the half of the kingdom.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then Esther the queen answered and said, If I have found favour in thy sight, O king, and if it please the king, let my life be given me at my petition, and my people at my request:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For we are sold, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen, I had held my tongue, although the enemy could not countervail the kingâ€™s damage.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king Ahasuerus answered and said unto Esther the queen, Who is he, and where is he, that durst presume in his heart to do so?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Esther said, The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king arising from the banquet of wine in his wrath went into the palace garden: and Haman stood up to make request for his life to Esther the queen; for he saw that there was evil determined against him by the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king returned out of the palace garden into the place of the banquet of wine; and Haman was fallen upon the bed whereon Esther was. Then said the king, Will he force the queen also before me in the house? As the word went out of the kingâ€™s mouth, they covered Hamanâ€™s face.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Harbonah, one of the chamberlains, said before the king, Behold also, the gallows fifty cubits high, which Haman had made for Mordecai, who had spoken good for the king, standeth in the house of Haman. Then the king said, Hang him thereon.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the kingâ€™s wrath pacified.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jewsâ€™ enemy unto Esther the queen. And Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was unto her.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it unto Mordecai. And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Esther spake yet again before the king, and fell down at his feet, and besought him with tears to put away the mischief of Haman the Agagite, and his device that he had devised against the Jews.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king held out the golden sceptre toward Esther. So Esther arose, and stood before the king,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And said, If it please the king, and if I have favour in his sight, and the thing seem right before the king, and I be pleasing in his eyes, let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews which are in all the kingâ€™s provinces:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For how can I endure to see the evil that shall come unto my people? or how can I endure to see the destruction of my kindred?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king Ahasuerus said unto Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, Behold, I have given Esther the house of Haman, and him they have hanged upon the gallows, because he laid his hand upon the Jews.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Write ye also for the Jews, as it liketh you, in the kingâ€™s name, and seal it with the kingâ€™s ring: for the writing which is written in the kingâ€™s name, and sealed with the kingâ€™s ring, may no man reverse.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then were the kingâ€™s scribes called at that time in the third month, that is, the month Sivan, on the three and twentieth day thereof; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded unto the Jews, and to the lieutenants, and the deputies and rulers of the provinces which are from India unto Ethiopia, an hundred twenty and seven provinces, unto every province according to the writing thereof, and unto every people after their language, and to the Jews according to their writing, and according to their language.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he wrote in the king Ahasuerusâ€™ name, and sealed it with the kingâ€™s ring, and sent letters by posts on horseback, and riders on mules, camels, and young dromedaries:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Wherein the king granted the Jews which were in every city to gather themselves together, and to stand for their life, to destroy, to slay and to cause to perish, all the power of the people and province that would assault them, both little ones and women, and to take the spoil of them for a prey,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Upon one day in all the provinces of king Ahasuerus, namely, upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The copy of the writing for a commandment to be given in every province was published unto all people, and that the Jews should be ready against that day to avenge themselves on their enemies.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So the posts that rode upon mules and camels went out, being hastened and pressed on by the kingâ€™s commandment. And the decree was given at Shushan the palace.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mordecai went out from the presence of the king in royal apparel of blue and white, and with a great crown of gold, and with a garment of fine linen and purple: and the city of Shushan rejoiced and was glad.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The Jews had light, and gladness, and joy, and honour.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And in every province, and in every city, whithersoever the kingâ€™s commandment and his decree came, the Jews had joy and gladness, a feast and a good day. And many of the people of the land became Jews; for the fear of the Jews fell upon them.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now in the twelfth month, that is, the month Adar, on the thirteenth day of the same, when the kingâ€™s commandment and his decree drew near to be put in execution, in the day that the enemies of the Jews hoped to have power over them, (though it was turned to the contrary, that the Jews had rule over them that hated them;)

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The Jews gathered themselves together in their cities throughout all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus, to lay hand on such as sought their hurt: and no man could withstand them; for the fear of them fell upon all people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And all the rulers of the provinces, and the lieutenants, and the deputies, and officers of the king, helped the Jews; because the fear of Mordecai fell upon them.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For Mordecai was great in the kingâ€™s house, and his fame went out throughout all the provinces: for this man Mordecai waxed greater and greater.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Thus the Jews smote all their enemies with the stroke of the sword, and slaughter, and destruction, and did what they would unto those that hated them.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And in Shushan the palace the Jews slew and destroyed five hundred men.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Parshandatha, and Dalphon, and Aspatha,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Poratha, and Adalia, and Aridatha,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Parmashta, and Arisai, and Aridai, and Vajezatha,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the enemy of the Jews, slew they; but on the spoil laid they not their hand.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: On that day the number of those that were slain in Shushan the palace was brought before the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said unto Esther the queen, The Jews have slain and destroyed five hundred men in Shushan the palace, and the ten sons of Haman; what have they done in the rest of the kingâ€™s provinces? now what is thy petition? and it shall be granted thee: or what is thy request further? and it shall be done.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then said Esther, If it please the king, let it be granted to the Jews which are in Shushan to do to morrow also according unto this dayâ€™s decree, and let Hamanâ€™s ten sons be hanged upon the gallows.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king commanded it so to be done: and the decree was given at Shushan; and they hanged Hamanâ€™s ten sons.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For the Jews that were in Shushan gathered themselves together on the fourteenth day also of the month Adar, and slew three hundred men at Shushan; but on the prey they laid not their hand.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But the other Jews that were in the kingâ€™s provinces gathered themselves together, and stood for their lives, and had rest from their enemies, and slew of their foes seventy and five thousand, but they laid not their hands on the prey,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: On the thirteenth day of the month Adar; and on the fourteenth day of the same rested they, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But the Jews that were at Shushan assembled together on the thirteenth day thereof, and on the fourteenth thereof; and on the fifteenth day of the same they rested, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Therefore the Jews of the villages, that dwelt in the unwalled towns, made the fourteenth day of the month Adar a day of gladness and feasting, and a good day, and of sending portions one to another.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mordecai wrote these things, and sent letters unto all the Jews that were in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus, both nigh and far,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: To stablish this among them, that they should keep the fourteenth day of the month Adar, and the fifteenth day of the same, yearly,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: As the days wherein the Jews rested from their enemies, and the month which was turned unto them from sorrow to joy, and from mourning into a good day: that they should make them days of feasting and joy, and of sending portions one to another, and gifts to the poor.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the Jews undertook to do as they had begun, and as Mordecai had written unto them;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Because Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Agagite, the enemy of all the Jews, had devised against the Jews to destroy them, and had cast Pur, that is, the lot, to consume them, and to destroy them;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But when Esther came before the king, he commanded by letters that his wicked device, which he devised against the Jews, should return upon his own head, and that he and his sons should be hanged on the gallows.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Wherefore they called these days Purim after the name of Pur. Therefore for all the words of this letter, and of that which they had seen concerning this matter, and which had come unto them,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The Jews ordained, and took upon them, and upon their seed, and upon all such as joined themselves unto them, so as it should not fail, that they would keep these two days according to their writing, and according to their appointed time every year;

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, every family, every province, and every city; and that these days of Purim should not fail from among the Jews, nor the memorial of them perish from their seed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then Esther the queen, the daughter of Abihail, and Mordecai the Jew, wrote with all authority, to confirm this second letter of Purim.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he sent the letters unto all the Jews, to the hundred twenty and seven provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, with words of peace and truth,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: To confirm these days of Purim in their times appointed, according as Mordecai the Jew and Esther the queen had enjoined them, and as they had decreed for themselves and for their seed, the matters of the fastings and their cry.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the decree of Esther confirmed these matters of Purim; and it was written in the book.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king Ahasuerus laid a tribute upon the land, and upon the isles of the sea.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And all the acts of his power and of his might, and the declaration of the greatness of Mordecai, whereunto the king advanced him, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For Mordecai the Jew was next unto king Ahasuerus, and great among the Jews, and accepted of the multitude of his brethren, seeking the wealth of his people, and speaking peace to all his seed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Unto the church of God which is at Corinth, to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be saints, with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and in all knowledge;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: So that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who shall also confirm you unto the end, that ye may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: God is faithful, by whom ye were called unto the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
