Text: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for the sins of the whole world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But whoso keepeth his word, in him verily is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Brethren, I write no new commandment unto you, but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which ye have heard from the beginning.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Again, a new commandment I write unto you, which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is in darkness even until now.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light, and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because that darkness hath blinded his eyes.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his nameâ€™s sake.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I write unto you, fathers, because ye have known him that is from the beginning. I write unto you, young men, because ye have overcome the wicked one. I write unto you, little children, because ye have known the Father.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I have written unto you, fathers, because ye have known him that is from the beginning. I have written unto you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the wicked one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, it is the last time: and as ye have heard that antichrist shall come, even now are there many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last time.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us: but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But ye have an unction from the Holy One, and ye know all things.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Who is a liar but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ? He is antichrist, that denieth the Father and the Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father: he that acknowledgeth the Son hath the Father also.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning. If that which ye have heard from the beginning shall remain in you, ye also shall continue in the Son, and in the Father.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the promise that he hath promised us, even eternal life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: These things have I written unto you concerning them that seduce you.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But the anointing which ye have received of him abideth in you, and ye need not that any man teach you: but as the same anointing teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and even as it hath taught you, ye shall abide in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And now, little children, abide in him; that, when he shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be ashamed before him at his coming.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If ye know that he is righteous, ye know that every one that doeth righteousness is born of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And every man that hath this hope in him purifieth himself, even as he is pure.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And ye know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen him, neither known him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, let no man deceive you: he that doeth righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever is born of God doth not commit sin; for his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whosoever doeth not righteousness is not of God, neither he that loveth not his brother.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For this is the message that ye heard from the beginning, that we should love one another.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Not as Cain, who was of that wicked one, and slew his brother. And wherefore slew he him? Because his own works were evil, and his brotherâ€™s righteous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Marvel not, my brethren, if the world hate you.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We know that we have passed from death unto life, because we love the brethren. He that loveth not his brother abideth in death.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But whoso hath this worldâ€™s good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his bowels of compassion from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For if our heart condemn us, God is greater than our heart, and knoweth all things.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, then have we confidence toward God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is his commandment, That we should believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, as he gave us commandment.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And he that keepeth his commandments dwelleth in him, and he in him. And hereby we know that he abideth in us, by the Spirit which he hath given us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby know ye the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And every spirit that confesseth not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is not of God: and this is that spirit of antichrist, whereof ye have heard that it should come; and even now already is it in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world, and the world heareth them.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: No man hath seen God at any time. If we love one another, God dwelleth in us, and his love is perfected in us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we have known and believed the love that God hath to us. God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in love.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We love him, because he first loved us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If a man say, I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for he that loveth not his brother whom he hath seen, how can he love God whom he hath not seen?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his brother also.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, and keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: This is he that came by water and blood, even Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that beareth witness, because the Spirit is truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For there are three that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost: and these three are one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And there are three that bear witness in earth, the Spirit, and the water, and the blood: and these three agree in one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which he hath testified of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that believeth on the Son of God hath the witness in himself: he that believeth not God hath made him a liar; because he believeth not the record that God gave of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the record, that God hath given to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of the Son of God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on the name of the Son of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And if we know that he hear us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If any man see his brother sin a sin which is not unto death, he shall ask, and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto death. There is a sin unto death: I do not say that he shall pray for it.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: All unrighteousness is sin: and there is a sin not unto death.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We know that whosoever is born of God sinneth not; but he that is begotten of God keepeth himself, and that wicked one toucheth him not.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we know that we are of God, and the whole world lieth in wickedness.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we know that the Son of God is come, and hath given us an understanding, that we may know him that is true, and we are in him that is true, even in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God, and eternal life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: To an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Of which salvation the prophets have enquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace that should come unto you:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every manâ€™s work, pass the time of your sojourning here in fear:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, as silver and gold, from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren, see that ye love one another with a pure heart fervently:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For all flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever. And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, all evil speakings,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: If so be ye have tasted that the Lord is gracious.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: To whom coming, as unto a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, and precious,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Unto you therefore which believe he is precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, even to them which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Which in time past were not a people, but are now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Dearly beloved, I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by your good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lordâ€™s sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As free, and not using your liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Honour all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Servants, be subject to your masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For this is thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For what glory is it, if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer for it, ye take it patiently, this is acceptable with God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed himself to him that judgeth righteously:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But let it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Finally, be ye all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, be pitiful, be courteous:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord is against them that do evil.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And who is he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But and if ye suffer for righteousnessâ€™ sake, happy are ye: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For it is better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: The like figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: That he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with them to the same excess of riot, speaking evil of you:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Use hospitality one to another without grudging.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As every man hath received the gift, even so minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: If any man speak, let him speak as the oracles of God; if any man minister, let him do it as of the ability which God giveth: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened unto you:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christâ€™s sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy are ye; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, or as a thief, or as an evildoer, or as a busybody in other menâ€™s matters.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Yet if any man suffer as a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God on this behalf.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For the time is come that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if it first begin at us, what shall the end be of them that obey not the gospel of God?

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls to him in well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight thereof, not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Neither as being lords over Godâ€™s heritage, but being ensamples to the flock.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder. Yea, all of you be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Whom resist stedfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren that are in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle you.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: To him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: By Silvanus, a faithful brother unto you, as I suppose, I have written briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God wherein ye stand.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: The church that is at Babylon, elected together with you, saluteth you; and so doth Marcus my son.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity. Peace be with you all that are in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Remembering without ceasing your work of faith, and labour of love, and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ, in the sight of God and our Father;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Knowing, brethren beloved, your election of God.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For our gospel came not unto you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Ghost, and in much assurance; as ye know what manner of men we were among you for your sake.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And ye became followers of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: So that ye were ensamples to all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For from you sounded out the word of the Lord not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith to God-ward is spread abroad; so that we need not to speak any thing.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For they themselves shew of us what manner of entering in we had unto you, and how ye turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead, even Jesus, which delivered us from the wrath to come.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But even after that we had suffered before, and were shamefully entreated, as ye know, at Philippi, we were bold in our God to speak unto you the gospel of God with much contention.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For our exhortation was not of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But as we were allowed of God to be put in trust with the gospel, even so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, which trieth our hearts.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For neither at any time used we flattering words, as ye know, nor a cloke of covetousness; God is witness:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Nor of men sought we glory, neither of you, nor yet of others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: So being affectionately desirous of you, we were willing to have imparted unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring night and day, because we would not be chargeable unto any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Ye are witnesses, and God also, how holily and justly and unblameably we behaved ourselves among you that believe:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: As ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a father doth his children,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That ye would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing, because, when ye received the word of God which ye heard of us, ye received it not as the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which effectually worketh also in you that believe.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judaea are in Christ Jesus: for ye also have suffered like things of your own countrymen, even as they have of the Jews:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they might be saved, to fill up their sins alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Are not even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming?

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye are our glory and joy.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to be left at Athens alone;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And sent Timotheus, our brother, and minister of God, and our fellowlabourer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That no man should be moved by these afflictions: for yourselves know that we are appointed thereunto.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For verily, when we were with you, we told you before that we should suffer tribulation; even as it came to pass, and ye know.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this cause, when I could no longer forbear, I sent to know your faith, lest by some means the tempter have tempted you, and our labour be in vain.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But now when Timotheus came from you unto us, and brought us good tidings of your faith and charity, and that ye have good remembrance of us always, desiring greatly to see us, as we also to see you:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our affliction and distress by your faith:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For what thanks can we render to God again for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Night and day praying exceedingly that we might see your face, and might perfect that which is lacking in your faith?

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now God himself and our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we do toward you:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: To the end he may stablish your hearts unblameable in holiness before God, even our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all his saints.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Furthermore then we beseech you, brethren, and exhort you by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God, so ye would abound more and more.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye know what commandments we gave you by the Lord Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this is the will of God, even your sanctification, that ye should abstain from fornication:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honour;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Not in the lust of concupiscence, even as the Gentiles which know not God:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That no man go beyond and defraud his brother in any matter: because that the Lord is the avenger of all such, as we also have forewarned you and testified.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: He therefore that despiseth, despiseth not man, but God, who hath also given unto us his holy Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But as touching brotherly love ye need not that I write unto you: for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And indeed ye do it toward all the brethren which are in all Macedonia: but we beseech you, brethren, that ye increase more and more;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and that ye may have lack of nothing.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But I would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning them which are asleep, that ye sorrow not, even as others which have no hope.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with him.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we which are alive and remain unto the coming of the Lord shall not prevent them which are asleep.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Then we which are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And to esteem them very highly in love for their workâ€™s sake. And be at peace among yourselves.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: See that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Rejoice evermore.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Pray without ceasing.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Quench not the Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Despise not prophesyings.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Abstain from all appearance of evil.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Brethren, pray for us.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ, which is our hope;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Unto Timothy, my own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: As I besought thee to abide still at Ephesus, when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some that they teach no other doctrine,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Neither give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions, rather than godly edifying which is in faith: so do.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart, and of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: From which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Desiring to be teachers of the law; understanding neither what they say, nor whereof they affirm.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But we know that the law is good, if a man use it lawfully;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Knowing this, that the law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For whoremongers, for them that defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who hath enabled me, for that he counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who was before a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: but I obtained mercy, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This is a faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all longsuffering, for a pattern to them which should hereafter believe on him to life everlasting.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only wise God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This charge I commit unto thee, son Timothy, according to the prophecies which went before on thee, that thou by them mightest war a good warfare;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Holding faith, and a good conscience; which some having put away concerning faith have made shipwreck:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For kings, and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For there is one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Whereunto I am ordained a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the truth in Christ, and lie not;) a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I will therefore that men pray every where, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Notwithstanding she shall be saved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This is a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to teach;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Likewise must the deacons be grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And let these also first be proved; then let them use the office of a deacon, being found blameless.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Even so must their wives be grave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But refuse profane and old wivesâ€™ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: These things command and teach.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Rebuke not an elder, but intreat him as a father; and the younger men as brethren;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saintsâ€™ feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn. And, The labourer is worthy of his reward.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I charge thee before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other menâ€™s sins: keep thyself pure.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomachâ€™s sake and thine often infirmities.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Some menâ€™s sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and some men they follow after.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Likewise also the good works of some are manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and his doctrine be not blasphemed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That thou keep this commandment without spot, unrebukable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Which in his times he shall shew, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Which some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: As we said before, so say I now again, if any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jewsâ€™ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And profited in the Jewsâ€™ religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my motherâ€™s womb, and called me by his grace,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lordâ€™s brother.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And they glorified God in me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to them which were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: To whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But of these who seemed to be somewhat, (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth no manâ€™s person:) for they who seemed to be somewhat in conference added nothing to me:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as the gospel of the circumcision was unto Peter;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: (For he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles:)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we should go unto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Only they would that we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Peter before them all, If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is therefore Christ the minister of sin? God forbid.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I am crucified with Christ: neverthless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness come by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, doeth he it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached before the gospel unto Abraham, saying, In thee shall all nations be blessed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
