Text: And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But the tongue can no man tame; it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual, devilish.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For where envying and strife is, there is confusion and every evil work.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Go to now, ye rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye have condemned and killed the just; and he doth not resist you.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Behold, we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; and your nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life;

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: (For the life was manifested, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and shew unto you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested unto us;)

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And these things write we unto you, that your joy may be full.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: This then is the message which we have heard of him, and declare unto you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie, and do not the truth:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not. And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for the sins of the whole world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But whoso keepeth his word, in him verily is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Brethren, I write no new commandment unto you, but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which ye have heard from the beginning.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Again, a new commandment I write unto you, which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is in darkness even until now.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light, and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because that darkness hath blinded his eyes.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his nameâ€™s sake.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I write unto you, fathers, because ye have known him that is from the beginning. I write unto you, young men, because ye have overcome the wicked one. I write unto you, little children, because ye have known the Father.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I have written unto you, fathers, because ye have known him that is from the beginning. I have written unto you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the wicked one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, it is the last time: and as ye have heard that antichrist shall come, even now are there many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last time.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us: but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But ye have an unction from the Holy One, and ye know all things.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Who is a liar but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ? He is antichrist, that denieth the Father and the Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father: he that acknowledgeth the Son hath the Father also.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning. If that which ye have heard from the beginning shall remain in you, ye also shall continue in the Son, and in the Father.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the promise that he hath promised us, even eternal life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: These things have I written unto you concerning them that seduce you.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But the anointing which ye have received of him abideth in you, and ye need not that any man teach you: but as the same anointing teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and even as it hath taught you, ye shall abide in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And now, little children, abide in him; that, when he shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be ashamed before him at his coming.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If ye know that he is righteous, ye know that every one that doeth righteousness is born of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And every man that hath this hope in him purifieth himself, even as he is pure.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And ye know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen him, neither known him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, let no man deceive you: he that doeth righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever is born of God doth not commit sin; for his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whosoever doeth not righteousness is not of God, neither he that loveth not his brother.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For this is the message that ye heard from the beginning, that we should love one another.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Not as Cain, who was of that wicked one, and slew his brother. And wherefore slew he him? Because his own works were evil, and his brotherâ€™s righteous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Marvel not, my brethren, if the world hate you.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We know that we have passed from death unto life, because we love the brethren. He that loveth not his brother abideth in death.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But whoso hath this worldâ€™s good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his bowels of compassion from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For if our heart condemn us, God is greater than our heart, and knoweth all things.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, then have we confidence toward God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is his commandment, That we should believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, as he gave us commandment.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And he that keepeth his commandments dwelleth in him, and he in him. And hereby we know that he abideth in us, by the Spirit which he hath given us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby know ye the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And every spirit that confesseth not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is not of God: and this is that spirit of antichrist, whereof ye have heard that it should come; and even now already is it in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world, and the world heareth them.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: No man hath seen God at any time. If we love one another, God dwelleth in us, and his love is perfected in us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we have known and believed the love that God hath to us. God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in love.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We love him, because he first loved us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If a man say, I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for he that loveth not his brother whom he hath seen, how can he love God whom he hath not seen?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his brother also.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, and keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: This is he that came by water and blood, even Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that beareth witness, because the Spirit is truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For there are three that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost: and these three are one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And there are three that bear witness in earth, the Spirit, and the water, and the blood: and these three agree in one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which he hath testified of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that believeth on the Son of God hath the witness in himself: he that believeth not God hath made him a liar; because he believeth not the record that God gave of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the record, that God hath given to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of the Son of God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on the name of the Son of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And if we know that he hear us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If any man see his brother sin a sin which is not unto death, he shall ask, and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto death. There is a sin unto death: I do not say that he shall pray for it.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: All unrighteousness is sin: and there is a sin not unto death.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We know that whosoever is born of God sinneth not; but he that is begotten of God keepeth himself, and that wicked one toucheth him not.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we know that we are of God, and the whole world lieth in wickedness.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we know that the Son of God is come, and hath given us an understanding, that we may know him that is true, and we are in him that is true, even in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God, and eternal life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Yet for loveâ€™s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers of my grace.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things which happened unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other places;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: According to my earnest expectation and my hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life, or by death.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But if I live in the flesh, this is the fruit of my labour: yet what I shall choose I wot not.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christâ€™s.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you, to me indeed is not grievous, but for you it is safe.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the concision.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For we are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Though I might also have confidence in the flesh. If any other man thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh, I more:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, an Hebrew of the Hebrews; as touching the law, a Pharisee;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Concerning zeal, persecuting the church; touching the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But what things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Yea doubtless, and I count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but dung, that I may win Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And be found in him, not having mine own righteousness, which is of the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is of God by faith:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being made conformable unto his death;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: If by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let us therefore, as many as be perfect, be thus minded: and if in any thing ye be otherwise minded, God shall reveal even this unto you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Nevertheless, whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Brethren, be followers together of me, and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: (For many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Whose end is destruction, whose God is their belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things.)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all things unto himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my dearly beloved.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and with other my fellowlabourers, whose names are in the book of life.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Those things, which ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me, do: and the God of peace shall be with you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at the last your care of me hath flourished again; wherein ye were also careful, but ye lacked opportunity.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: every where and in all things I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye did communicate with my affliction.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Now ye Philippians know also, that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church communicated with me as concerning giving and receiving, but ye only.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Not because I desire a gift: but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I have all, and abound: I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you, an odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren which are with me greet you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: All the saints salute you, chiefly they that are of Caesarâ€™s household.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The ungodly are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD, and against his anointed, saying,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the LORD shall have them in derision.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potterâ€™s vessel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call unto him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, LORD, only makest me dwell in safety.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the LORD will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O LORD, how long?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy merciesâ€™ sake.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O LORD my God, If I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O LORD, our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing praises to the LORD, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Put them in fear, O LORD: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the wicked boasteth of his heartâ€™s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORDâ€™s throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the LORD; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will sing unto the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the LORD is his refuge.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the LORD bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them that fear the LORD. He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O my soul, thou hast said unto the LORD, Thou art my Lord: my goodness extendeth not to thee;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will bless the LORD, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have set the LORD always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear the right, O LORD, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O LORD, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From men which are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will love thee, O LORD, my strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my stay.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore hath the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou wilt light my candle: the LORD my God will enlighten my darkness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the LORD is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For who is God save the LORD? or who is a rock save our God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He maketh my feet like hindsâ€™ feet, and setteth me upon my high places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They cried, but there was none to save them: even unto the LORD, but he answered them not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people whom I have not known shall serve me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend thee;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners: the LORD fulfil all thy petitions.
