Text: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the LORD is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O come, let us sing unto the LORD: let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the LORD is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In his hand are the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills is his also.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the LORD our maker.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O sing unto the LORD a new song: sing unto the LORD, all the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing unto the LORD, bless his name; shew forth his salvation from day to day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Declare his glory among the heathen, his wonders among all people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the LORD is great, and greatly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For all the gods of the nations are idols: but the LORD made the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Honour and majesty are before him: strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give unto the LORD, O ye kindreds of the people, give unto the LORD glory and strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name: bring an offering, and come into his courts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Say among the heathen that the LORD reigneth: the world also shall be established that it shall not be moved: he shall judge the people righteously.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the field be joyful, and all that is therein: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Before the LORD: for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he shall judge the world with righteousness, and the people with his truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Clouds and darkness are round about him: righteousness and judgment are the habitation of his throne.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His lightnings enlightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols: worship him, all ye gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Zion heard, and was glad; and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments, O LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou, LORD, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye that love the LORD, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rejoice in the LORD, ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O sing unto the LORD a new song; for he hath done marvellous things: his right hand, and his holy arm, hath gotten him the victory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD, all the earth: make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing unto the LORD with the harp; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With trumpets and sound of cornet make a joyful noise before the LORD, the King.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the floods clap their hands: let the hills be joyful together

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Before the LORD; for he cometh to judge the earth: with righteousness shall he judge the world, and the people with equity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD reigneth; let the people tremble: he sitteth between the cherubims; let the earth be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is great in Zion; and he is high above all the people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them praise thy great and terrible name; for it is holy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The kingâ€™s strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Exalt ye the LORD our God, and worship at his footstool; for he is holy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name; they called upon the LORD, and he answered them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the ordinance that he gave them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou answeredst them, O LORD our God: thou wast a God that forgavest them, though thou tookest vengeance of their inventions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Exalt the LORD our God, and worship at his holy hill; for the LORD our God is holy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD, all ye lands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Serve the LORD with gladness: come before his presence with singing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Know ye that the LORD he is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, and bless his name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the LORD is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will sing of mercy and judgment: unto thee, O LORD, will I sing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked person.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O LORD, shall endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So the heathen shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When the LORD shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the LORD behold the earth;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To declare the name of the LORD in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagleâ€™s.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Like as a father pitieth his children, so the LORD pitieth them that fear him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto childrenâ€™s children;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the LORD, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless ye the LORD, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be removed for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth manâ€™s heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The trees of the LORD are full of sap; the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat from God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O LORD, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There go the ships: there is that leviathan, whom thou hast made to play therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat in due season.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The glory of the LORD shall endure for ever: the LORD shall rejoice in his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the LORD, O my soul. Praise ye the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Seek the LORD, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He is the LORD our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Nevertheless he saved them for his nameâ€™s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and covered the company of Abiram.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They joined themselves also unto Baalpeor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: These see the works of the LORD, and his wonders in the deep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their witâ€™s end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O god, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy nameâ€™s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill the places with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye the LORD. I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The works of the LORD are great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His work is honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the LORD is gracious and full of compassion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The works of his hands are verity and judgment; all his commandments are sure.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They stand fast for ever and ever, and are done in truth and uprightness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend is his name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye the LORD. Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye the LORD. Praise, O ye servants of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same the LORDâ€™s name is to be praised.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is like unto the LORD our God, who dwelleth on high,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He maketh the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truthâ€™s sake.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is now their God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of menâ€™s hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will bless them that fear the LORD, both small and great.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD shall increase you more and more, you and your children.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye are blessed of the LORD which made heaven and earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORDâ€™s: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into silence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I love the LORD, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then called I upon the name of the LORD; O LORD, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the LORD hath dealt bountifully with thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said in my haste, All men are liars.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What shall I render unto the LORD for all his benefits toward me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O LORD, truly I am thy servant; I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the courts of the LORDâ€™s house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O praise the LORD, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. Praise ye the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, and set me in a large place.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They compassed me about like bees: they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the LORD:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the LORDâ€™s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God is the LORD, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto thy judgments at all times.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, which do err from thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it unto the end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy mercies come also unto me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art my portion, O LORD: I have said that I would keep thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I intreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according unto thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The proud have digged pits for me, which are not after thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am thine, save me: for I have sought thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O how I love thy law! it is my meditation all the day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How sweet are thy words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O LORD, according unto thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul is continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, even unto the end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is time for thee, LORD, to work: for they have made void thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O LORD: I will keep thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mine eyes prevent the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O LORD, quicken me according to thy judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great are thy tender mercies, O LORD: quicken me according to thy judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O LORD, according to thy lovingkindness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD: give me understanding according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and thy law is my delight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he heard me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My help cometh from the LORD, which made heaven and earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is thy keeper: the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Jerusalem is builded as a city that is compact together:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, unto the testimony of Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my brethren and companionsâ€™ sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because of the house of the LORD our God I will seek thy good.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until that he have mercy upon us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, now may Israel say;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, when men rose up against us:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the LORD, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are escaped.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that trust in the LORD shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the LORD is round about his people from henceforth even for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Do good, O LORD, unto those that be good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the LORD shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The LORD hath done great things for them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD hath done great things for us; whereof we are glad.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the south.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Except the LORD build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the LORD keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lo, children are an heritage of the LORD: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is every one that feareth the LORD; that walketh in his ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house: thy children like olive plants round about thy table.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD shall bless thee out of Zion: and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yea, thou shalt see thy childrenâ€™s children, and peace upon Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The LORD is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you: we bless you in the name of the LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O LORD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

Book: The Book of Psalms
