Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But if it be of works, then it is no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: (According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For if the firstfruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy, so are the branches.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Boast not against the branches. But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be graffed in.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not thee.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be graffed in: for God is able to graff them in again.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural branches, be graffed into their own olive tree?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fatherâ€™s sakes.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: So we, being many, are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Or ministry, let us wait on our ministering: or he that teacheth, on teaching;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he that giveth, let him do it with simplicity; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let love be without dissimulation. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil. Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger to execute wrath upon him that doeth evil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Wherefore ye must needs be subject, not only for wrath, but also for conscience sake.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For for this cause pay ye tribute also: for they are Godâ€™s ministers, attending continually upon this very thing.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not covet; and if there be any other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour: therefore love is the fulfilling of the law.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And that, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep: for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to fulfil the lusts thereof.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye, but not to doubtful disputations.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who art thou that judgest another manâ€™s servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day alike. Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regard it. He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lordâ€™s.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brotherâ€™s way.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But if thy brother be grieved with thy meat, now walkest thou not charitably. Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For he that in these things serveth Christ is acceptable to God, and approved of men.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For meat destroy not the work of God. All things indeed are pure; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offence.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: It is good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor any thing whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Hast thou faith? have it to thyself before God. Happy is he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith: for whatsoever is not of faith is sin.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Let every one of us please his neighbour for his good to edification.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For even Christ pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Wherefore receive ye one another, as Christ also received us to the glory of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises made unto the fathers:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy; as it is written, For this cause I will confess to thee among the Gentiles, and sing unto thy name.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And again he saith, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and laud him, all ye people.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And again, Esaias saith, There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles; in him shall the Gentiles trust.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Nevertheless, brethren, I have written the more boldly unto you in some sort, as putting you in mind, because of the grace that is given to me of God,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Through mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem, and round about unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another manâ€™s foundation:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But as it is written, To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see: and they that have not heard shall understand.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But now having no more place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come unto you;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Whensoever I take my journey into Spain, I will come to you: for I trust to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first I be somewhat filled with your company.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: When therefore I have performed this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come by you into Spain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christâ€™s sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: That I may be delivered from them that do not believe in Judaea; and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be accepted of the saints;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: I commend unto you Phebe our sister, which is a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: That ye receive her in the Lord, as becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever business she hath need of you: for she hath been a succourer of many, and of myself also.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who have for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Likewise greet the church that is in their house. Salute my well-beloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen, and my fellow-prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Apelles approved in Christ. Salute them which are of Aristobulusâ€™ household.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Greet them that be of the household of Narcissus, which are in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord. Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints which are with them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Salute one another with an holy kiss. The churches of Christ salute you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For they that are such serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For your obedience is come abroad unto all men. I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple concerning evil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: I Tertius, who wrote this epistle, salute you in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Gaius mine host, and of the whole church, saluteth you. Erastus the chamberlain of the city saluteth you, and Quartus a brother.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But now is made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, made known to all nations for the obedience of faith:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Now it came to pass in the days when the judges ruled, that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Bethlehemjudah went to sojourn in the country of Moab, he, and his wife, and his two sons.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And the name of the man was Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Bethlehemjudah. And they came into the country of Moab, and continued there.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Elimelech Naomiâ€™s husband died; and she was left, and her two sons.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And they took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they dwelled there about ten years.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her two sons and her husband.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then she arose with her daughters in law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that the LORD had visited his people in giving them bread.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Wherefore she went forth out of the place where she was, and her two daughters in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto the land of Judah.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Naomi said unto her two daughters in law, Go, return each to her motherâ€™s house: the LORD deal kindly with you, as ye have dealt with the dead, and with me.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: The LORD grant you that ye may find rest, each of you in the house of her husband. Then she kissed them; and they lifted up their voice, and wept.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And they said unto her, Surely we will return with thee unto thy people.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Naomi said, Turn again, my daughters: why will ye go with me? are there yet any more sons in my womb, that they may be your husbands?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Turn again, my daughters, go your way; for I am too old to have an husband. If I should say, I have hope, if I should have an husband also to night, and should also bear sons;

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Would ye tarry for them till they were grown? would ye stay for them from having husbands? nay, my daughters; for it grieveth me much for your sakes that the hand of the LORD is gone out against me.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And they lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother in law; but Ruth clave unto her.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Ruth said, Intreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Where thou diest, will I die, and there will I be buried: the LORD do so to me, and more also, if ought but death part thee and me.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: When she saw that she was stedfastly minded to go with her, then she left speaking unto her.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So they two went until they came to Bethlehem. And it came to pass, when they were come to Bethlehem, that all the city was moved about them, and they said, Is this Naomi?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she said unto them, Call me not Naomi, call me Mara: for the Almighty hath dealt very bitterly with me.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: I went out full and the LORD hath brought me home again empty: why then call ye me Naomi, seeing the LORD hath testified against me, and the Almighty hath afflicted me?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Bethlehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Naomi had a kinsman of her husbandâ€™s, a mighty man of wealth, of the family of Elimelech; and his name was Boaz.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Ruth the Moabitess said unto Naomi, Let me now go to the field, and glean ears of corn after him in whose sight I shall find grace. And she said unto her, Go, my daughter.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she went, and came, and gleaned in the field after the reapers: and her hap was to light on a part of the field belonging unto Boaz, who was of the kindred of Elimelech.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And, behold, Boaz came from Bethlehem, and said unto the reapers, The LORD be with you. And they answered him, The LORD bless thee.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then said Boaz unto his servant that was set over the reapers, Whose damsel is this?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And the servant that was set over the reapers answered and said, It is the Moabitish damsel that came back with Naomi out of the country of Moab:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she said, I pray you, let me glean and gather after the reapers among the sheaves: so she came, and hath continued even from the morning until now, that she tarried a little in the house.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then said Boaz unto Ruth, Hearest thou not, my daughter? Go not to glean in another field, neither go from hence, but abide here fast by my maidens:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Let thine eyes be on the field that they do reap, and go thou after them: have I not charged the young men that they shall not touch thee? and when thou art athirst, go unto the vessels, and drink of that which the young men have drawn.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then she fell on her face, and bowed herself to the ground, and said unto him, Why have I found grace in thine eyes, that thou shouldest take knowledge of me, seeing I am a stranger?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Boaz answered and said unto her, It hath fully been shewed me, all that thou hast done unto thy mother in law since the death of thine husband: and how thou hast left thy father and thy mother, and the land of thy nativity, and art come unto a people which thou knewest not heretofore.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: The LORD recompense thy work, and a full reward be given thee of the LORD God of Israel, under whose wings thou art come to trust.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then she said, Let me find favour in thy sight, my lord; for that thou hast comforted me, and for that thou hast spoken friendly unto thine handmaid, though I be not like unto one of thine handmaidens.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Boaz said unto her, At mealtime come thou hither, and eat of the bread, and dip thy morsel in the vinegar. And she sat beside the reapers: and he reached her parched corn, and she did eat, and was sufficed, and left.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And when she was risen up to glean, Boaz commanded his young men, saying, Let her glean even among the sheaves, and reproach her not:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And let fall also some of the handfuls of purpose for her, and leave them, that she may glean them, and rebuke her not.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So she gleaned in the field until even, and beat out that she had gleaned: and it was about an ephah of barley.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she took it up, and went into the city: and her mother in law saw what she had gleaned: and she brought forth, and gave to her that she had reserved after she was sufficed.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And her mother in law said unto her, Where hast thou gleaned to day? and where wroughtest thou? blessed be he that did take knowledge of thee. And she shewed her mother in law with whom she had wrought, and said, The manâ€™s name with whom I wrought to day is Boaz.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Naomi said unto her daughter in law, Blessed be he of the LORD, who hath not left off his kindness to the living and to the dead. And Naomi said unto her, The man is near of kin unto us, one of our next kinsmen.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Ruth the Moabitess said, He said unto me also, Thou shalt keep fast by my young men, until they have ended all my harvest.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Naomi said unto Ruth her daughter in law, It is good, my daughter, that thou go out with his maidens, that they meet thee not in any other field.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So she kept fast by the maidens of Boaz to glean unto the end of barley harvest and of wheat harvest; and dwelt with her mother in law.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then Naomi her mother in law said unto her, My daughter, shall I not seek rest for thee, that it may be well with thee?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And now is not Boaz of our kindred, with whose maidens thou wast? Behold, he winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thy raiment upon thee, and get thee down to the floor: but make not thyself known unto the man, until he shall have done eating and drinking.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And it shall be, when he lieth down, that thou shalt mark the place where he shall lie, and thou shalt go in, and uncover his feet, and lay thee down; and he will tell thee what thou shalt do.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she said unto her, All that thou sayest unto me I will do.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she went down unto the floor, and did according to all that her mother in law bade her.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And when Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn: and she came softly, and uncovered his feet, and laid her down.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And it came to pass at midnight, that the man was afraid, and turned himself: and, behold, a woman lay at his feet.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he said, Who art thou? And she answered, I am Ruth thine handmaid: spread therefore thy skirt over thine handmaid; for thou art a near kinsman.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he said, Blessed be thou of the LORD, my daughter: for thou hast shewed more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning, inasmuch as thou followedst not young men, whether poor or rich.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And now, my daughter, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou requirest: for all the city of my people doth know that thou art a virtuous woman.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And now it is true that I am thy near kinsman: howbeit there is a kinsman nearer than I.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Tarry this night, and it shall be in the morning, that if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman, well; let him do the kinsmanâ€™s part: but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee, then will I do the part of a kinsman to thee, as the LORD liveth: lie down until the morning.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she lay at his feet until the morning: and she rose up before one could know another. And he said, Let it not be known that a woman came into the floor.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Also he said, Bring the vail that thou hast upon thee, and hold it. And when she held it, he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her: and she went into the city.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And when she came to her mother in law, she said, Who art thou, my daughter? And she told her all that the man had done to her.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she said, These six measures of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not empty unto thy mother in law.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then said she, Sit still, my daughter, until thou know how the matter will fall: for the man will not be in rest, until he have finished the thing this day.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then went Boaz up to the gate, and sat him down there: and, behold, the kinsman of whom Boaz spake came by; unto whom he said, Ho, such a one! turn aside, sit down here. And he turned aside, and sat down.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he took ten men of the elders of the city, and said, Sit ye down here. And they sat down.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he said unto the kinsman, Naomi, that is come again out of the country of Moab, selleth a parcel of land, which was our brother Elimelechâ€™s:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And I thought to advertise thee, saying, Buy it before the inhabitants, and before the elders of my people. If thou wilt redeem it, redeem it: but if thou wilt not redeem it, then tell me, that I may know: for there is none to redeem it beside thee; and I am after thee. And he said, I will redeem it.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then said Boaz, What day thou buyest the field of the hand of Naomi, thou must buy it also of Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of the dead, to raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And the kinsman said, I cannot redeem it for myself, lest I mar mine own inheritance: redeem thou my right to thyself; for I cannot redeem it.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Now this was the manner in former time in Israel concerning redeeming and concerning changing, for to confirm all things; a man plucked off his shoe, and gave it to his neighbour: and this was a testimony in Israel.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Therefore the kinsman said unto Boaz, Buy it for thee. So he drew off his shoe.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Boaz said unto the elders, and unto all the people, Ye are witnesses this day, that I have bought all that was Elimelechâ€™s, and all that was Chilionâ€™s and Mahlonâ€™s, of the hand of Naomi.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Moreover Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, have I purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance, that the name of the dead be not cut off from among his brethren, and from the gate of his place: ye are witnesses this day.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And all the people that were in the gate, and the elders, said, We are witnesses. The LORD make the woman that is come into thine house like Rachel and like Leah, which two did build the house of Israel: and do thou worthily in Ephratah, and be famous in Bethlehem:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And let thy house be like the house of Pharez, whom Tamar bare unto Judah, of the seed which the LORD shall give thee of this young woman.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So Boaz took Ruth, and she was his wife: and when he went in unto her, the LORD gave her conception, and she bare a son.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And the women said unto Naomi, Blessed be the LORD, which hath not left thee this day without a kinsman, that his name may be famous in Israel.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he shall be unto thee a restorer of thy life, and a nourisher of thine old age: for thy daughter in law, which loveth thee, which is better to thee than seven sons, hath born him.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Naomi took the child, and laid it in her bosom, and became nurse unto it.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And the women her neighbours gave it a name, saying, There is a son born to Naomi; and they called his name Obed: he is the father of Jesse, the father of David.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Now these are the generations of Pharez: Pharez begat Hezron,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Hezron begat Ram, and Ram begat Amminadab,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Amminadab begat Nahshon, and Nahshon begat Salmon,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Salmon begat Boaz, and Boaz begat Obed,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Obed begat Jesse, and Jesse begat David.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And whether we be afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so shall ye be also of the consolation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But as God is true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, is God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Sufficient to such a man is this punishment, which was inflicted of many.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: So that contrariwise ye ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm your love toward him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To whom ye forgive any thing, I forgive also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave it, for your sakes forgave I it in the person of Christ;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christâ€™s gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now thanks be unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To the one we are the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. And who is sufficient for these things?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some others, epistles of commendation to you, or letters of commendation from you?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Forasmuch as ye are manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency is of God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But if the ministration of death, written and engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which glory was to be done away:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if the ministration of condemnation be glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if that which is done away was glorious, much more that which remaineth is glorious.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And not as Moses, which put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which vail is done away in Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the LORD.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every manâ€™s conscience in the sight of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesusâ€™ sake.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesusâ€™ sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present us with you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For all things are for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen are eternal.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing is God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore we are always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For whether we be beside ourselves, it is to God: or whether we be sober, it is for your cause.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And that he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we him no more.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And all things are of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech you by us: we pray you in Christâ€™s stead, be ye reconciled to God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We then, as workers together with him, beseech you also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (For he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation.)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: By the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and yet true;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: O ye Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto my children,) be ye also enlarged.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean thing; and I will receive you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I speak not this to condemn you: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings, within were fears.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though it were but for a season.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, what clearing of yourselves, yea, what indignation, yea, what fear, yea, what vehement desire, yea, what zeal, yea, what revenge! In all things ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, I did it not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, which I made before Titus, is found a truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For to their power, I bear record, yea, and beyond their power they were willing of themselves;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and take upon us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And this they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And herein I give my advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now therefore perform the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to will, so there may be a performance also out of that which ye have.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if there be first a willing mind, it is accepted according to that a man hath, and not according to that he hath not.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I mean not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want, that their abundance also may be a supply for your want: that there may be equality:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As it is written, He that had gathered much had nothing over; and he that had gathered little had no lack.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But thanks be to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which I have in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Whether any do enquire of Titus, he is my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren be enquired of, they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as a matter of bounty, and not as of covetousness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But this I say, He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And God is able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all things, may abound to every good work:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (As it is written, He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth for ever.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for your food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for your liberal distribution unto them, and unto all men;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I beseech you, that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christâ€™s, let him of himself think this again, that, as he is Christâ€™s, even so are we Christâ€™s.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For his letters, say they, are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are present.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we will not boast of things without our measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we stretch not ourselves beyond our measure, as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in preaching the gospel of Christ:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other menâ€™s labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another manâ€™s line of things made ready to our hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
