Text: But though I be rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I robbed other churches, taking wages of them, to do you service.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and so will I keep myself.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: That which I speak, I speak it not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye yourselves are wise.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour you, if a man take of you, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Are they Hebrews? so am I. Are they Israelites? so am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so am I.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Of the Jews five times received I forty stripes save one.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In journeyings often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils by mine own countrymen, in perils by the heathen, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brethren;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me to be, or that he heareth of me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christâ€™s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? walked we not in the same steps?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: This is the third time I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward is not weak, but is mighty in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God. For we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves. Know ye not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except ye be reprobates?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now I pray to God that ye do no evil; not that we should appear approved, but that ye should do that which is honest, though we be as reprobates.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we are glad, when we are weak, and ye are strong: and this also we wish, even your perfection.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the power which the Lord hath given me to edification, and not to destruction.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Greet one another with an holy kiss.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: All the saints salute you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: The elder unto the elect lady and her children, whom I love in the truth; and not I only, but also all they that have known the truth;

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: For the truthâ€™s sake, which dwelleth in us, and shall be with us for ever.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Grace be with you, mercy, and peace, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: I rejoiced greatly that I found of thy children walking in truth, as we have received a commandment from the Father.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: And now I beseech thee, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment unto thee, but that which we had from the beginning, that we love one another.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: And this is love, that we walk after his commandments. This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: For many deceivers are entered into the world, who confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh. This is a deceiver and an antichrist.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Look to yourselves, that we lose not those things which we have wrought, but that we receive a full reward.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not God. He that abideth in the doctrine of Christ, he hath both the Father and the Son.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: If there come any unto you, and bring not this doctrine, receive him not into your house, neither bid him God speed:

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: For he that biddeth him God speed is partaker of his evil deeds.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Having many things to write unto you, I would not write with paper and ink: but I trust to come unto you, and speak face to face, that our joy may be full.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: The children of thy elect sister greet thee. Amen.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For if these things be in you, and abound, they make you that ye shall neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye know them, and be established in the present truth.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shewed me.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but cast them down to hell, and delivered them into chains of darkness, to be reserved unto judgment;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And spared not the old world, but saved Noah the eighth person, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemned them with an overthrow, making them an ensample unto those that after should live ungodly;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And delivered just Lot, vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds;)

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government. Presumptuous are they, selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But these, as natural brute beasts, made to be taken and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they understand not; and shall utterly perish in their own corruption;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Which have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray, following the way of Balaam the son of Bosor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But was rebuked for his iniquity: the dumb ass speaking with manâ€™s voice forbad the madness of the prophet.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried with a tempest; to whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For when they speak great swelling words of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, through much wantonness, those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he brought in bondage.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after they have known it, to turn from the holy commandment delivered unto them.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But it is happened unto them according to the true proverb, The dog is turned to his own vomit again; and the sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: This second epistle, beloved, I now write unto you; in both which I stir up your pure minds by way of remembrance:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: That ye may be mindful of the words which were spoken before by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of us the apostles of the Lord and Saviour:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And saying, Where is the promise of his coming? for since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For this they willingly are ignorant of, that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of the water and in the water:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But the heavens and the earth, which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Seeing then that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought ye to be in all holy conversation and godliness,

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of God, wherein the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Nevertheless we, according to his promise, look for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And account that the longsuffering of our Lord is salvation; even as our beloved brother Paul also according to the wisdom given unto him hath written unto you;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: As also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things; in which are some things hard to be understood, which they that are unlearned and unstable wrest, as they do also the other scriptures, unto their own destruction.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Ye therefore, beloved, seeing ye know these things before, beware lest ye also, being led away with the error of the wicked, fall from your own stedfastness.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the charity of every one of you all toward each other aboundeth;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: So that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye endure:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Which is a manifest token of the righteous judgment of God, that ye may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which ye also suffer:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Seeing it is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And to you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with his mighty angels,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: In flaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God, and that obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfil all the good pleasure of his goodness, and the work of faith with power:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Let no man deceive you by any means: for that day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For the mystery of iniquity doth already work: only he who now letteth will let, until he be taken out of the way.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Even him, whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And for this cause God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have free course, and be glorified, even as it is with you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men: for all men have not faith.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly, and not after the tradition which he received of us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Neither did we eat any manâ€™s bread for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we might not be chargeable to any of you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Yet count him not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: The salutation of Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every epistle: so I write.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and I am persuaded that in thee also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Wherefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the putting on of my hands.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel according to the power of God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And if a man also strive for masteries, yet is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, even unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Therefore I endure all things for the electâ€™s sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If we suffer, we shall also reign with him: if we deny him, he also will deny us:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If we believe not, yet he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Of these things put them in remembrance, charging them before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, but to the subverting of the hearers.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But shun profane and vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the masterâ€™s use, and prepared unto every good work.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And that they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto all men, as theirs also was.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Persecutions, afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of them all the Lord delivered me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I charge thee therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: At my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me: I pray God that it may not be laid to their charge.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Do thy diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Because that for his nameâ€™s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Demetrius hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: But I trust I shall shortly see thee, and we shall speak face to face. Peace be to thee. Our friends salute thee. Greet the friends by name.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of Godâ€™s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucreâ€™s sake.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Titus
Text: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him, to shew unto his servants things which must shortly come to pass; and he sent and signified it by his angel unto his servant John:

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Who bare record of the word of God, and of the testimony of Jesus Christ, and of all things that he saw.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Blessed is he that readeth, and they that hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things which are written therein: for the time is at hand.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: John to the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace be unto you, and peace, from him which is, and which was, and which is to come; and from the seven Spirits which are before his throne;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, and the first begotten of the dead, and the prince of the kings of the earth. Unto him that loved us, and washed us from our sins in his own blood,

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father; to him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they also which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him. Even so, Amen.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord, which is, and which was, and which is to come, the Almighty.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I was in the Spirit on the Lordâ€™s day, and heard behind me a great voice, as of a trumpet,

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Saying, I am Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and, What thou seest, write in a book, and send it unto the seven churches which are in Asia; unto Ephesus, and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamos, and unto Thyatira, and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia, and unto Laodicea.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I turned to see the voice that spake with me. And being turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And in the midst of the seven candlesticks one like unto the Son of man, clothed with a garment down to the foot, and girt about the paps with a golden girdle.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: His head and his hairs were white like wool, as white as snow; and his eyes were as a flame of fire;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And his feet like unto fine brass, as if they burned in a furnace; and his voice as the sound of many waters.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And he had in his right hand seven stars: and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword: and his countenance was as the sun shineth in his strength.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And when I saw him, I fell at his feet as dead. And he laid his right hand upon me, saying unto me, Fear not; I am the first and the last:

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I am he that liveth, and was dead; and, behold, I am alive for evermore, Amen; and have the keys of hell and of death.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Write the things which thou hast seen, and the things which are, and the things which shall be hereafter;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: The mystery of the seven stars which thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks. The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches: and the seven candlesticks which thou sawest are the seven churches.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Unto the angel of the church of Ephesus write; These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I know thy works, and thy labour, and thy patience, and how thou canst not bear them which are evil: and thou hast tried them which say they are apostles, and are not, and hast found them liars:

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my nameâ€™s sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Nevertheless I have somewhat against thee, because thou hast left thy first love.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen, and repent, and do the first works; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will remove thy candlestick out of his place, except thou repent.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaitanes, which I also hate.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the tree of life, which is in the midst of the paradise of God.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And unto the angel of the church in Smyrna write; These things saith the first and the last, which was dead, and is alive;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I know thy works, and tribulation, and poverty, (but thou art rich) and I know the blasphemy of them which say they are Jews, and are not, but are the synagogue of Satan.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Fear none of those things which thou shalt suffer: behold, the devil shall cast some of you into prison, that ye may be tried; and ye shall have tribulation ten days: be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write; These things saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I know thy works, and where thou dwellest, even where Satanâ€™s seat is: and thou holdest fast my name, and hast not denied my faith, even in those days wherein Antipas was my faithful martyr, who was slain among you, where Satan dwelleth.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: But I have a few things against thee, because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed unto idols, and to commit fornication.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitanes, which thing I hate.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Repent; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna, and will give him a white stone, and in the stone a new name written, which no man knoweth saving he that receiveth it.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write; These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire, and his feet are like fine brass;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I know thy works, and charity, and service, and faith, and thy patience, and thy works; and the last to be more than the first.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Notwithstanding I have a few things against thee, because thou sufferest that woman Jezebel, which calleth herself a prophetess, to teach and to seduce my servants to commit fornication, and to eat things sacrificed unto idols.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I gave her space to repent of her fornication; and she repented not.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Behold, I will cast her into a bed, and them that commit adultery with her into great tribulation, except they repent of their deeds.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: But unto you I say, and unto the rest in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, and which have not known the depths of Satan, as they speak; I will put upon you none other burden.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: But that which ye have already hold fast till I come.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And he that overcometh, and keepeth my works unto the end, to him will I give power over the nations:

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I will give him the morning star.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And unto the angel of the church in Sardis write; These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars; I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and hold fast, and repent. If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come on thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis which have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with me in white: for they are worthy.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that overcometh, the same shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, but I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write; These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth, and no man shutteth; and shutteth, and no man openeth;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I know thy works: behold, I have set before thee an open door, and no man can shut it: for thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Behold, I will make them of the synagogue of Satan, which say they are Jews, and are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come and worship before thy feet, and to know that I have loved thee.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation, which shall come upon all the world, to try them that dwell upon the earth.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Behold, I come quickly: hold that fast which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more out: and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, which is new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God: and I will write upon him my new name.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write; These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: So then because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spue thee out of my mouth.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Because thou sayest, I am rich, and increased with goods, and have need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked:

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne, even as I also overcame, and am set down with my Father in his throne.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: After this I looked, and, behold, a door was opened in heaven: and the first voice which I heard was as it were of a trumpet talking with me; which said, Come up hither, and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, and one sat on the throne.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone: and there was a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And round about the throne were four and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white raiment; and they had on their heads crowns of gold.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And before the throne there was a sea of glass like unto crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, were four beasts full of eyes before and behind.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And the first beast was like a lion, and the second beast like a calf, and the third beast had a face as a man, and the fourth beast was like a flying eagle.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And the four beasts had each of them six wings about him; and they were full of eyes within: and they rest not day and night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, LORD God Almighty, which was, and is, and is to come.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And when those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever,

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: The four and twenty elders fall down before him that sat on the throne, and worship him that liveth for ever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying,

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose the seals thereof?

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And no man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the book, neither to look thereon.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And one of the elders saith unto me, Weep not: behold, the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose the seven seals thereof.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And when he had taken the book, the four beasts and four and twenty elders fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps, and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders: and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands;

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: Saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And the four beasts said, Amen. And the four and twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And there went out another horse that was red: and power was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
Text: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see. And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.

Book: The Revelation of Saint John the Divine
